definition: to regard as/to view/to consider sth as/to treat as
to recognize/to know/to admit
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: The loss of the declaration or any alterations made on it may be considered breaking the regulations.
sentences.chinese: 凡遗失本单或申报单作涂改均被认作违法。

sentences.english: We insist on regarding them as they are aged and weak.
sentences.chinese: 自己们强行把他们认作是垂老地，弱势地。

sentences.english: He always considered her as his real mother.
sentences.chinese: 他一向把她认作他的亲娘。

sentences.english: Kindergarteners who could not read were even more likely to mistake medicine for candy.
sentences.chinese: 不会读写的幼儿园小朋友更容易将药片认作糖果。

sentences.english: Doctors used to think of RBD as an isolated disorder.
sentences.chinese: 医生一致把RBD认作是某种孤立的紊乱。

sentences.english: Athens, Ohio is one of the most haunted places in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 俄亥俄的雅典城被认作是美国最猛鬼的地方之一。

to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
mistake/error/to miss/to harm/to delay/to neglect/mistakenly

to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to drive out/to oust
to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)
to become related by marriage/to marry
adopted daughter
to liken to/to compare to
to address sb deferentially/title/honorific
